channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Maddie Durdant-Hollamby: Woman found in house was stabbed to death
item.description: Maddie Durdant-Hollamby was stabbed while Benjamin Green's injuries were self-inflicted, police say.

item.title: Declan Donnelly: Men admit plot to steal presenter's car
item.description: The group of four admit they had planned to steal about £750,000 worth of high-value vehicles.

item.title: Colin Pitchfork: Double child murderer released from prison
item.description: Colin Pitchfork was jailed in 1988 for raping and murdering two 15-year-old girls in Leicestershire.

item.title: Banksy-painted building in Lowestoft adds £200k to asking price
item.description: The old electrical shop is now up for sale at £500,000 after Banksy confirmed the art was genuine.

item.title: West Sussex foster couple cared for more than 600 children
item.description: Pauline and Roger Fitter say watching the results of their efforts has been very rewarding.

item.title: Andover A303 crash: Recovery driver 'died helping motorist'
item.description: Tom Watson, 30, died along with two women in the four-vehicle crash near Andover last week.

item.title: Benjamin Mendy: Manchester City player to remain in custody on rape charges
item.description: Defender Benjamin Mendy, who has been charged with rape, has a bail application refused by a judge.

item.title: Creamfields: Tiesto fan's ashes fired from confetti cannon in headline set
item.description: A celebration of Stuart Mitchell's life ended with his ashes being released during Tiesto's set.

item.title: Male suicide: Mike McCarthy sets up support group after son's death
item.description: Mike McCarthy says his son Ross had asked his family to campaign for better mental health support.

item.title: Man pushed in canal at Leigh had 35 stab wounds, court told
item.description: Scott Anderton suffered stab wounds from his head to his shins in a brutal attack, a jury hears.

item.title: UK worker shortage: Farmers give fruit and veg away for free
item.description: Producers fear crops will be left to rot as they struggle to attract workers to harvest them.

item.title: Geronimo the alpaca: Owner blocked from observing post-mortem
item.description: Helen Macdonald says the government is "immensely arrogant" and "concealing processes".

item.title: Luton airport worker died five years after hangar door crush
item.description: Susan Dorbon was left tetraplegic after being found trapped between hangar doors, an inquest hears.

item.title: Family of ducks waddles through University of Nottingham library
item.description: The mother and her ducklings were "calm and unflustered" as they walked around George Green Library.

item.title: Childcare costs: London parents call for review
item.description: Childcare costs are 30% higher in inner London than the national average, a study found.

item.title: Football fan credits daughter with changing his racist beliefs
item.description: Football fan Neil says he changed his attitude with the help of his daughter, Millie.

item.title: Drummer, 11, plays with Foo Fighters at LA gig
item.description: Nandi Bushell joins the American rock band on stage in Los Angeles.

item.title: Feminist Collages London: Tackling violence against women with slogan posters
item.description: A movement that started in Paris, has now spread into locations across the globe.

item.title: England v India: Decision between Curran, Woakes and Wood for Oval Test
item.description: England are mulling over their pace options for the crucial fourth Test against India at the Oval, beginning on Thursday.

item.title: Ballance ton gives Yorkshire victory chance at Hampshire
item.description: Gary Ballance's century gives Yorkshire a chance of a final-day County Championship victory against Hampshire at The Ageas Bowl.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Boccia player David Smith retains individual title with thrilling victory
item.description: Britain's David Smith likens himself to footballer Cristiano Ronaldo as he retains his Paralympic boccia individual title.
